title: Hospitality Education Content Development Using Design Thinking-Based CLIL (Content and Language Integrated Learning)

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Acquiring methods to apply design thinking when designing CLIL (Content and Language Integrated Learning) lessons in hospitality for educators, developing practical instructional content

learning_goals: Learners can apply the five stages of design thinking (Empathize-Define-Ideate-Prototype-Test) to CLIL lesson design.
Learners enhance their ability to design CLIL activities that solve real-world hospitality problems through mathematical modeling.
Learners can develop a mobile-friendly microlearning CLIL lesson model.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
